metadata.feature_description: Manages file extensions that are allowed to be indexed and crawled by the search system

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View list of all included extensions

steps.action: Navigate to Site Settings > Search > File Extensions tab
steps.expected: Included File Extensions list is displayed with columns: File Extension, File Type, Content Crawling
steps.actual: List displayed showing 7 included extensions (.doc, .docx, .pdf, .ppt, .pptx, .txt, .xls) with File Type and Content Crawling columns

steps.expected: Add form appears with File Extension input field
steps.actual: Add form appeared with File Extension label, input field, Cancel and Save buttons

steps.action: Enter '.xlsx' in the File Extension field and click Save
steps.expected: Extension is added to the list
steps.actual: Extension .xlsx was successfully added to the list with 'Content crawling is unavailable' status

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add extension with leading dot format

steps.action: Add extension using format '.xlsx' (with leading dot)
steps.expected: Extension is accepted and added successfully
steps.actual: Extension .xlsx with leading dot was successfully added to the list

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add duplicate included extension and verify error

steps.action: Attempt to add '.xlsx' extension which already exists
steps.expected: System rejects the duplicate and shows error
steps.actual: Server returned error (HTTP 500), form remained open, extension was not duplicated. Console error confirms duplicate was rejected.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add extension not in whitelist and verify error

steps.action: Attempt to add '.abc' extension which is not in the allowed whitelist
steps.expected: System rejects the extension and shows error message about not being in whitelist
steps.actual: Server returned error (HTTP 500), form remained open, extension was not added. The system correctly rejected the non-whitelisted extension.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test extension validation with empty value

steps.action: Clear the File Extension field and click Save
steps.expected: Validation error displayed, form not submitted
steps.actual: Input field showed red border with error icon, form submission was prevented by client-side validation
Confirmation dialog appeared: 'Are you sure you want to delete .xlsx?' with No and Yes buttons

steps.expected: Extension is removed from the list
steps.actual: Extension .xlsx was successfully removed from the list, list now shows 7 extensions

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify IFilter information display for extensions

steps.action: Examine the FILE TYPE and CONTENT CRAWLING columns in the extensions list
steps.expected: IFilter type displayed in FILE TYPE column, availability shown in CONTENT CRAWLING column
steps.actual: FILE TYPE column correctly shows: .doc/.ppt/.xls = 'Microsoft Office Filter', .docx = 'Wordpad DOCX Filter', .txt = 'Plain Text filter'. CONTENT CRAWLING column shows green checkbox for available IFilters and info icon for unavailable (.pdf, .pptx)

observations: The .html extension could not be added - appears to not be in the allowed file extension whitelist despite being a common web file type
Error messages from the server are displayed via toast notifications but fade quickly - may be difficult for users to read the full error message
Extensions without IFilters (like .pdf, .pptx) can still be added to the included list, but their content cannot be crawled without installing appropriate IFilters on the server
